byline.original: By RICHARD C. PADDOCK and FELIPE VILLAMOR

abstract: Edgar Matobato, self-described hit man, recants previous accusations implicating Pres Rodrigo Duterte of Philippines as explicitly ordering extrajudicial killings, during four-hour long session before Filipino Senate committee; Matobato does, however, restate previous claims of witnessing Duterte speak to commander of Davao City death squad, who then ordered squad to carry out killing.
lead_paragraph: Under questioning, Edgar Matobato said he did not hear the president order an execution but saw him give orders to a death squad commander.
snippet: Under questioning, Edgar Matobato said he did not hear the president order an execution but saw him give orders to a death squad commander....

headline.main: Professed Hit Man Tempers Claims of Rodrigo Duterte’s Role in Philippine Killings
headline.print_headline: Tempered Testimony on Filipino Death Squad
